intro: Baeolepis, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plants typically grow in coastal areas and are adapted to salty, windy environments. Baeolepis species are often found in Mediterranean regions and parts of southern Europe. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in coastal ecosystems.
